posts.post_content: Don't see how this card could be much use. You can temporarily get rid of their best creature, but what if their best card is sitting in their hand and the only reason they haven't played it yet is because they don't have what they need to play it?

Posted By: holgir (8/4/2009 6:06:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@garbagegatherer- This would be fine with Radiate. Let's say your opponent has out 10 permanents. You'd target all of them, and then he'd put up to 10 cards in to play. Is it likely he'll have 10 cards in hand? No. Is it likely he's holding all permanents and no instants or sorceries? No. It isn't an instant win play, no. But it's funny and it will usually give you board position. Twitch and Radiate is also a good combo, so I'm not saying you're wrong about that.  
  
That said, this card by itself isn't that great of an idea. Bouncing one permanent that they've already been able to play for and giving them something in their hand they couldn't afford yet is a bad idea.
posts.html:
@garbagegatherer- This would be fine with Radiate. Let's say your opponent has out 10 permanents. You'd target all of them, and then he'd put up to 10 cards in to play. Is it likely he'll have 10 cards in hand? No. Is it likely he's holding all permanents and no instants or sorceries? No. It isn't an instant win play, no. But it's funny and it will usually give you board position. Twitch and Radiate is also a good combo, so I'm not saying you're wrong about that.

That said, this card by itself isn't that great of an idea. Bouncing one permanent that they've already been able to play for and giving them something in their hand they couldn't afford yet is a bad idea.

Posted By: Imperialstonedragon (5/13/2011 2:14:21 PM)

posts.post_content: Taken by itself, I don't understand the rationale behind this card. Maybe they were thinking that giving blue a way to deal with creatures required a powerful drawback to compensate for granting the color something that is otherwise out of it's slice of the color pie... But it's not really granting blue anything it didn't have already -- [Time Ebb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Ebb), [Ether Well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ether Well), ect. Perhaps R&D forgot that the card was going to the top of the library, rather than the bottom. If it were going to the bottom, then it could be considered blue creature removal, and there would be a valid reason for it's existence.
posts.html:
Taken by itself, I don't understand the rationale behind this card. But it's not really granting blue anything it didn't have already -- Time Ebb, Ether Well, ect. Perhaps R&D forgot that the card was going to the top of the library, rather than the bottom. If it were going to the bottom, then it could be considered blue creature removal, and there would be a valid reason for it's existence.

posts.post_content:
Would I be able to use [Redirect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Redirect) on Metamophose to target a permanent I control?  
  
Lets say I cast Metamorphose and in response to my own metamorphose I cast redirect to one of my creatures, so then I would be able to drop something big and mean for only a fraction of the mana....   
  
Any thoughts?
posts.html:
Would I be able to use Redirect on Metamophose to target a permanent I control?

Lets say I cast Metamorphose and in response to my own metamorphose I cast redirect to one of my creatures, so then I would be able to drop something big and mean for only a fraction of the mana....

Any thoughts?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: HorseMittens (2/15/2012 7:53:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Mind Control cards are good with this; as is waiting until late game when they most likely won't have a hand. Possible {B}/{U} deck mixing discard in could utilize this earlier. I think I'll get a playset and try it out.   
  
You could also mix with things that hurt them somehow on casting (costing extra mana, bouncing permanents, losing life, etc..)  
  
Basically you slow their tempo (if done right) stay card neutral, and deny the opponent much needed answers they may be seeking. Bouncing land with this while using other cards to eat or bounce lands could allow you to slow them to a crawl. Seems better than the 1.7\* rating it has now. Again, use this LATE game, not just when you have the mana.
posts.html:

Basically you slow their tempo (if done right) stay card neutral, and deny the opponent much needed answers they may be seeking. Bouncing land with this while using other cards to eat or bounce lands could allow you to slow them to a crawl. Seems better than the 1.7* rating it has now.
